places.description: Yellowwood Forest Retreat is a tranquil, owner-run forest escape on the Wild Coast near Morgan’s Bay. Set along a riverside under mature yellowwoods, it offers shaded camping and a mix of rustic self-catering options with a friendly tea garden, pizzeria and bar on site. Campers get level sites, forest trails, a swimming hole, and easy access to Morgan’s Bay beach about 1.5 km away.
places.directions: From the N2, take the Kei Mouth or East London turn-off toward Morgan’s Bay. In Morgan’s Bay, follow signs to Link Road. Yellowwood Forest is at 661 Link Road, about 1.5 km from the main beach.

places.meta_description: Camp under indigenous trees at Yellowwood Forest Retreat in Morgan’s Bay. Shaded sites, hot showers, braais, electricity options, tea garden, pizzeria and a riverside swimming hole, 1.5 km from the beach.
places.facilities_summary: Shaded forest campsites, ablutions with hot showers and flush toilets, braai areas, electricity points on selected sites, tea garden, wood-fired pizzeria, licensed bar, children’s play area, riverside swimming hole, forest walks, Wi-Fi.
places.ai_summary: Yellowwood Forest Retreat is a quiet, riverside forest campsite near Morgan’s Bay with shaded sites, hot showers, braais and optional power. On-site café, pizzeria and bar make self-catering easy, and the beach is a short hop away. Ideal for families, nature lovers and budget travellers.
places.raw_data: Capacity up to 172 across the property. Address: 661 Link Road, Morgan’s Bay, Eastern Cape. Camping options include non-electrical and electrical sites. Lekkeslaap lists from R230 per night for two on non-electrical and R390 per night for two with electricity. Morgan Bay portal notes off-peak R322 plus R15 conservation fee per person, and peak R429 plus R15 per person. On-site facilities include a licensed tea garden and pizzeria open daily, children’s play area, forest trails and a swimming hole. Phone 043 841 1598; WhatsApp 060 655 8152; Email info@yellowwoodforest.co.za.
places.experiences_raw: Forest birdwatching, riverside swims, wood-fired pizza nights, coastal hikes, beach days at Morgan’s Bay, family play area, craft beer and coffee at the tea garden.
